title: When RiotTantram shows up on the boards

replies.body:
When people think riot doesn't watch the boards then tantrum shows up to deliver justice

{{sticker:sg-miss-fortune}}
To be fair I think people mainly mean that in Gameplay. Riot is pretty often in M&G and Player Behavior.

That's probably because M&G is usually light hearted fun, player behavior is something that can be very easily checked and discussed, and gameplay is a long strain of "WTF riot doesn't know what they're doing with *insert flavor of the week topic here*! It's obvious that *insert stupidly over kill solution here* is the correct way to do this. Fire the rioter who decided to do this thing I don't like!"

You'll see rioters very often respond to well articulated posts discussing concerns with a certain change.
Actually they do that too, and it's proven most of the time when they update that one page where they talk about different things
